relation: I feel safe and there has never been any problems. They have a public safety office and they are very on top of everything.
I was apart of the teacher's club and it really helped me to connect to the school and other students with the same passions.
Cheap and still I feel like I am getting a great education!

Since it is a community college and not a university people do not live on campus and therefore there isn't a whole lot going on around the school. There are good places to eat and shop nearby though.
I have never been to there food places.
Although I would say it is challenging, it is not impossible. Work hard and you will succeed.
Do your FAFSA on time. Attend all your classes each one is important. Have an open mind to new situations.
It has a great community that feels close together. The teacher are always available to help. I have found the curriculum engaging and worth my time!

I am receiving my Associates degree this May, 2 years after graduating, and I am continuing my education at ASU this fall. The classes are the perfect size to meet new people but you still get plenty of attention from the teacher.}

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Do not miss class, be attentive while in class, constantly check the school website for homework, complete all homework assignments. Set aside time each day to complete homework and studying and to prepare for the next day at school. Login to rate or flag the reviews Lorena from Chandler, AZ 08/17/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 80 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Chandler Gilbert is a great college for any type of student. There offer great help in any area needed. There is always a learning center filled with tutors eager to help students achieve better grades. This college also offers various services that are useful for all students. Financial Aid, Flexible class schedules, a great library, and a great staff of professors that help students get their moneys worth of education. Tips for prospective students The advice I give to students is to focus on school and don't take breaks from school.
